alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 05 at 4:25PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Prolonged rain-on-snow event for Southeast Alaska... An atmospheric river will move over the Gulf of Alaska and into the panhandle for the Tuesday to Thursday time period. This will bring a prolonged period of moderate to heavy rain as the moisture band moves from north and south. Multiple waves will move along the main feature and produce impulses of heavier precipitation. Precise timing and location of the heaviest precipitation over Southeast Alaska is still vague, but ensembles and model solutions are converging on this being a significant rain event. This situation will continue to be monitored updated as more information becomes available.
